eventsFunctions.description: Flushes any unsaved data to the platform's storage. This function is expensive, and should primarily be used for critical changes where persistence needs to be immediate and known by the game. Non-critical changes should rely on the platform to persist them in the background.
eventsFunctions.name: FlushDataAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Flush data asynchronously

eventsFunctions.description: A unique identifier for the player. This is the standard Facebook Application-Scoped ID which is used for all Graph API calls. If your game shares an AppID with a native game this is the ID you will see in the native game too.
eventsFunctions.name: GetASIDAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Get ASID and set the result to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Gets ConnectedPlayers containing information about active players that are connected to the current player.

parameters.name: DataKeyString

parameters.name: Result

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the player's ID from the platform.

eventsFunctions.description: Shows the authentication prompt to the player. This allows the player to log in or register for an account. If the player successfully logs in or registers, the player API will be updated with the new player information.

eventsFunctions.description: Shows the link account prompt to the player. This allows the player to link their account to a different platform.
eventsFunctions.name: ShowLinkAccountPromptAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Show prompt to link account to different platform

eventsFunctions.description: Request that the player subscribe the bot associated to the game. The API will reject if the subscription fails - else, the player will subscribe the game bot.
eventsFunctions.name: SubscribeBotAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Subscribe to the bot

eventsFunctions.description: Opens a context selection dialog for the player. If the player selects an available context, the client will attempt to switch into that context, and resolve if successful. Otherwise, if the player exits the menu or the client fails to switch into the new context, this function will reject.
eventsFunctions.name: ChooseContextAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Opens a context selection dialog

eventsFunctions.description: Attempts to create a context between the current player and a specified player or a list of players.
eventsFunctions.name: CreateContextAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create a context with specified players with id _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Get current context id
eventsFunctions.name: GetContextID
eventsFunctions.sentence: Get context id

eventsFunctions.description: Gets an array of ConnectedPlayer objects containing information about active players in the current context (people who played the game in the current context in the last 90 days).
eventsFunctions.name: GetPlayersAsync
eventsFunctions.sentence: Get connected players and set the result to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the type of the current context.
eventsFunctions.name: GetContextType

eventsFunctions.description: This invokes a dialog to let the user invite one or more people to the game.

eventsFunctions.description: This invokes a dialog to let the user share specified content, as a post on the user's timeline

eventsFunctions.description: Logs a choice the player made in the game. This can be a powerful tool for balancing the game and understanding what content the players are interacting with the most.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Logs player decision _PARAM1_ for choice _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Logs the end of a level. To ensure the level timer is recorded the level name must match the name passed into the previous logLevelStart call. If it does not match then the timer will be logged at 0.
eventsFunctions.name: LogLevelEnd

eventsFunctions.name: LogLevelStart
eventsFunctions.sentence: Logs level _PARAM1_ start

eventsFunctions.description: Logs the player achieving a new level
eventsFunctions.name: LogLevelUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Logs level up to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.name: LogScore

eventsFunctions.description: Logs the player's social invite
eventsFunctions.name: LogSocialInvite
eventsFunctions.sentence: Logs social invite with placement _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Logs the player's social share
eventsFunctions.name: LogSocialShare
eventsFunctions.sentence: Logs social share with placement _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Logs the end of a tutorial. To ensure the level timer is recorded the tutorial name must match the name passed into the previous logTutorialStart call. If it does not match then the timer will be logged at 0

eventsFunctions.description: Retrieves the leaderboard score entries of the current player's connected players (including the current player), ordered by local rank within the set of connected players

parameters.description: The offset from the set of ordered connected player score entries to fetch from

parameters.name: Result

parameters.name: Count

parameters.name: Result

eventsFunctions.description: Updates the player's score. If the player has an existing score, the old score will only be replaced if the new score is better than it
